note: We offer special appreciation for the funding we received to complete this work. James Ryan, then Dean of the Harvard Gradu­ate School of Education, supported Alexis’ initial research through a Dean’s Summer Fellowship. The Bureau of Study Counsel helped with the costs of digi-
title: We wish to offer our deep appreciation to the student participants of the Harvard University Class of 1975 who shared their stories. We are grateful to William Perry and his team, who not only conducted and partially coded ­these interviews in the 1970s before abandoning the study but also had the foresight to meticulously preserve the data and the notes for posterity. Further, we thank the Harvard Bureau of Study Counsel (BSC) for holding ­these data, providing access, insights, and some funding to support this work. We especially thank BSC Director Abigail Lipson, who shared our enthusiasm and saw value in pursuing this study. We acknowledge the Harvard University Archives for providing access to documents that ­were stored long ago and nearly forgotten and the Harvard Media Production Center for digitizing the audio files in accordance with the confidentiality required by the data agreements
